p: Different results were found by Fontenelle etÂ al. ( 2008) in their research on the antifungal activity of the essential oils Croton argyrophylloides Muell., Croton nepetaefolius Baill. and C. zehntneri against C. albicans, C. tropicalis and Microsporum canis, using the diffusion in gel well method and the broth microdilution method for the MIC. These authors observed that C. nepetaefolius and C. argyrophylloides only demonstrated activity against M. canis, while the essential oil of C. zehntneri was effective against all the fungi tested.
